title: Dubowitz Syndrome: Clinical Overview and Epidemiology
short_description: A clinical summary document describing the demographics and prevalence of Dubowitz syndrome, a rare genetic condition affecting both males and females equally across all ethnicities.
long_description: This document provides an epidemiological overview of Dubowitz syndrome, a rare genetic disorder that affects individuals regardless of sex, ethnicity, or race. The content highlights that while only 150-200 cases have been documented in medical literature, researchers suspect the actual prevalence may be higher due to underdiagnosis. The document serves as a foundational reference for understanding the demographic distribution and potential scope of this uncommon syndrome in clinical practice.
